content.description: Climb up the wall using large chert nodules.
content.protection:
10 to 12 bolts per pitch.  Chain anchors at midpoint & on top.

Note: With a 60 meter rope, it is possible to combine the two pitches into one long lead and lower off the sport anchors back to to the ptich 1 chain anchors.  Then you can belay your second to the top of the second pitch and  lower them to the chain anchors or back to the ground.  Then you pull the rope, thread the chain anchors and rappel to the ground.

content.description:
P1:  Start between "Truckin'" and  "I Can See For Miles" and climb up pleasant, solid large chert to chain anchors at a small ledge.

P2:  Continue face climbing up to a second small ledge and continue on a steep chert face with right diagonalling crack.  Continue to the top anchors on thoughtful and technical face climbing.
content.protection:
About 10 - 12 bolts on each pitch. From the top anchors lower with one rope to the chain anchors of either "Stage Fright" or "I Can See For Miles". Single rope rappel back to the ground.

Note: With a 60 meter rope, it is possible to combine the two pitches into one long lead and lower off the sport anchors back to to the ptich 1 chain anchors.  Then you can belay your second to the top of the second pitch and  lower them to the chain anchors or back to the ground.  Then you pull the rope, thread the chain anchors and rappel to the ground.
content.location: Starts about  8 feet to the left of a small pillar like block near the base of the formation.

climbs.name: I Can See For Miles
climbs.fa: Mike Engle, Chris Barnes, & Vernon Phinney; June 2018

content.description:
Pitch 1:  Start with tough moves past the first two bolts and climb just left of a white streak on a orange face.  Aim for a a break in the trees to a ledge.  Continue up a short face to a second ledge and belay at chain anchors.

Pitch 2: Work up to and over a tough bulge 2 bolts off the ledge.  Continue on thin chert to a second smaller bulge just below the top anchors.
content.protection:
8 - 10 bolts per pitch.  Chain anchors at the top of the first pitch.  Sport anchor as the top of the second pitch.  Lead the second pitch and lower back to the comfortable ledge.  Second can TR or pull the rope and lead.  Rappel for the chain anchors to the ground with a single rope.

Note:   With a 60 meter rope, it's possible to lead in one long pitch and lower back to the pitch one chain anchors, however not recommended due to rope drag.
content.location: The route starts on an orange face below directly below a couple trees on a ledge about 30 feet up the face.

content.description:
Crux is at start of second pitch.

Excellent climbing on good solid chert.
content.protection:
1/2" bolts, chains at midpoint and sport anchor at top.

8 bolts on first & second pitches.

Note: With a 60 meter rope, it is possible to combine the two pitches into one long lead and lower off the sport anchors back to to the ptich 1 chain anchors.  Then you can belay your second to the top of the second pitch and  lower them to the chain anchors or back to the ground.  Then you pull the rope, thread the chain anchors and rappel to the ground.

content.description: Start 30 feet left of "Truckin" and climb up a smooth grey face with big moves on good pockets.  Gain a ledge below a chert face.  Thiin moves off the ledge lead to slighlty bigger holds.  Continue up engaging chert climbing to the anchors.
content.protection: About 14 bolts, sport anchors at top, and lower to ground with a 60 meter rope.
content.location: This is the left most route on American Beauty.  The route starts about 30 feet left of "Truckin'".

climbs.name: Black Betty
climbs.fa: Linda Engle & Annik Martin, June 2018; bolted by Chris Barnes

content.description: This climb follows the gully system between between American Beauty and Sea of Joy.  The first pitch works up a series of short faces to ledges and stances (5.6).  The second pitch (5.7) continues on steeper rock and works up really interesting runnels and sculpted grey limestone with the occasional chert hold thrown in.  Worth doing for the second pitch.
content.protection:
10 or 12 bolts per pitch. Chain anchors at the top of pitch one and sport anchors at the top of pitch two. One 60 meter rope to get off in one lower and one rappel.

Note: With a 60 meter rope, it is possible to combine the two pitches into one long lead and lower off the sport anchors back to to the ptich 1 chain anchors.  Then you can belay your second to the top of the second pitch and  lower them to the chain anchors or back to the ground.  Then you pull the rope, thread the chain anchors and rappel to the ground.
content.location: Starts about 10 feet right of "Fire and Rain".  Right most route on American Beauty.
